TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national born in DATE and residing in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant used to work as a cashier and accountant in a ORG - owned enterprise .
An audit undertaken in the enterprise at DATE revealed a cash deficit of MONEY .

In DATE the applicant was given a copy of the final act of the audit , which contained the ORG opinion that , inter alia , she had made deliberately false entries in the accounting books and had thus misappropriated funds .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were brought against the applicant . In DATE the investigator ( следовател ) , PERSON , questioned her in the framework of these proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and charged under Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in conjunction with Article CARDINAL of LAW ( NORP кодекс ) with misappropriation of funds in large amounts .

CARDINAL . On DATE investigator PERSON heard the applicant in the presence of her lawyer and decided to detain her on remand . On DATE , without having heard the applicant , a prosecutor from ORG ( PERSON прокуратура ) in GPE confirmed the investigator ’s decision to detain her .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against her detention to ORG ( ORG прокуратура ) . In accordance with the established practice the applicant ’s lawyer lodged the appeal with ORG . He stated that the applicant had not attempted to abscond or to obstruct the investigation during DATE since she had become aware of the criminal charges against her ; that she was no longer working as a cashier or accountant and could not , therefore , commit other crimes ; and that the applicant had undergone gynaecological surgery and had still not recovered completely .

CARDINAL . On DATE , before transmitting the appeal to ORG , a prosecutor of ORG confirmed the decision to detain the applicant on remand . The prosecutor found that the applicant was charged with a serious crime punishable by DATE imprisonment and that “ therefore , the [ detention on remand ] [ was ] lawful : it [ was ] based on the imperative provision of LAW процесуален кодекс ) ” ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The prosecutor further stated that the question whether or not LAW should be applied was to be assessed by the investigator and by the supervising prosecutor . In the applicant ’s case the investigator and the supervising prosecutor had not applied LAW “ in view of the current stage of the proceedings ” . It followed that the applicant ’s detention was lawful .

CARDINAL . By decision dated DATE and registered on CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for release . A further appeal against her detention on remand was dismissed by ORG by a letter of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG ( GPE съд ) against her detention on remand . In his written submissions to ORG the applicant ’s lawyer stated , inter alia , that the decision to detain the applicant on remand had been based solely on the gravity of the charges against her whereas other important factors had not been taken into account . Thus , the applicant had a permanent address where she lived with her husband and QUANTITY daughters . Also , the applicant had known about the criminal charges against her for DATE prior to her arrest but had made no attempt to abscond or obstruct the investigation . Furthermore , the evidence against the applicant was weak , it having been established that CARDINAL other persons had been in possession of a key to the cashier ’s office . The prosecutor had blindly followed the conclusions of the auditors who had pointed to the applicant on the sole ground that she had been the person in charge . However , there was nothing to show that the applicant had been the author of the false entries in the accounting books . The applicant ’s lawyer also invoked his client ’s medical condition and enclosed medical certificates .
CARDINAL . In accordance with the established practice the applicant ’s lawyer lodged his appeal and submissions through ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG transmitted the appeal together with the investigator ’s file to ORG . The covering letter , prepared by the prosecutor , stated , inter alia :

“ I consider that the appeal should be dismissed and that the detention on remand should be confirmed as being lawful . The charges concern a serious wilful crime within the meaning of LAW and , [ therefore ] , in accordance with LAW , the imposition of detention is obligatory .

The present case does not fall under LAW of LAW : [ it ] does not involve a situation where the accused has no possibility of absconding or reoffending , as required by ORG practice [ follows a reference to ORG practice – see paragraph CARDINAL below ] . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the court examined the case in camera , without the participation of the parties , and dismissed the appeal . The court stated , inter alia :

“ [ The charges against the applicant ] concern a serious crime within the meaning of LAW , that is , a crime under LAW , punishable by DATE imprisonment . In this respect there exists the requirement , under LAW , that detention on remand shall be imposed .

... [ The medical certificates submitted by the applicant ] reflect her state of health during DATE . No information concerning her current state of health has been submitted . It follows that currently there exist no circumstances requiring the modification of the measure ‘ detention on remand’ imposed on the [ applicant ] . Therefore the appeal is ill - founded and must be dismissed . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by CARDINAL medical experts who had been asked by the investigator in her case to establish , inter alia , whether the conditions of detention were dangerous for her health . In a report of DATE the experts found that the problems related to the surgery which she had undergone DATE did not affect her condition , and that she could remain in detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was urgently transferred to hospital due to pain in her gall bladder . On DATE she underwent surgery .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator in the applicant ’s case appointed another group of medical experts to examine the applicant . The experts found that the applicant needed a convalescence period which was incompatible with the conditions in detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s detention on remand was discontinued in view of her health problems by an order of ORG . The applicant was put under house arrest .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the investigator concluded his work on the case and sent the file to ORG with a proposal to submit an indictment in court . On an unspecified date the competent prosecutor returned the case to the investigator for further clarifications .
CARDINAL . According to the relevant provisions of LAW and to legal theory and practice , the prosecutor performs a dual function in criminal proceedings .

During the preliminary stage he supervises the investigation . He is competent , inter alia , to give mandatory instructions to the investigator ; to participate in examinations , searches or any other acts of investigation ; to withdraw a case from CARDINAL investigator and assign it to another , or to carry out the entire investigation , or parts of it , himself . He may also decide whether or not to terminate the proceedings , order additional investigations , or prepare an indictment and submit the case to court .
At the judicial stage he is entrusted with the task of prosecuting the accused .

CARDINAL . The investigator has a certain independence from the prosecutor in respect of his working methods and particular acts of investigation , but performs his functions under the latter ’s instructions and supervision ( Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ) . If an investigator objects to the prosecutor ’s instructions , he may apply to the higher prosecutor , whose decision is final and binding .

CARDINAL . Under Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure , the prosecutor and the investigator are under an obligation to collect both incriminating and exonerating evidence . Throughout criminal proceedings , the prosecutor must “ effect a supervisory control of lawfulness ” ( Article CARDINAL of the Code ) .

CARDINAL . An accused can be detained on remand by decision of an investigator or prosecutor . In cases where the decision to detain has been taken by an investigator without the prior consent of a prosecutor , it must be approved by a prosecutor within TIME . The prosecutor usually makes this decision on the basis of the file , without hearing the accused ( Code of Criminal Procedure , Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . There is no legal obstacle preventing the prosecutor who has taken the decision to detain an accused on remand , or who has approved an investigator ’s decision , from acting for the prosecution against the accused in any subsequent criminal proceedings . In practice this frequently occurs .

ORG has found that a former investigator who was appointed prosecutor may represent the prosecution at the trial of the same accused person on whose case he had been working as an investigator . As both the investigator and the prosecutor performed investigative functions there was no legal obstacle ( реш. от CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL по н.д. No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL на ВС NORP н.о. , бюл. кн. QUANTITY , стр. CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Article QUANTITY and QUANTITY provides as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Detention on remand shall be imposed [ in cases where the charges concern ] a serious wilful crime .
( CARDINAL ) In the cases under the preceding paragraph [ detention on remand ] may not be imposed if there is no danger of the accused absconding , obstructing justice or reoffending . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) Мярка за неотклонение задържане под стража се взема за тежко умишлено престъпление.

( CARDINAL ) PERSON случаите по ал. CARDINAL мярката за неотклонение може да не се вземе , ако няма опасност обвиняемият да се укрие , да осуети разкриването на обективната истина или да извърши друго престъпление. ”
According to LAW a crime is “ serious ” if it is punishable by more than DATE imprisonment .

CARDINAL . According to ORG practice LAW requires that a person charged with a “ serious wilful crime ” shall be detained on remand . The only exception is provided for under LAW , which empowers the prosecutor not to detain an accused where it is clear , beyond doubt , that there is no danger of absconding or reoffending . Such danger must be objectively excluded as , for example , in the case of an accused who is seriously ill , or aged , or who is detained on other grounds such as serving a sentence ( опред. No . CARDINAL . In some more recent decisions ORG has nevertheless embarked on analysis of the particular facts to justify findings that there existed a danger of absconding or reoffending ( опред. No . CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL , стр. CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . LAW , as in force at the relevant time , provided as follows :

“ The detained person shall be provided immediately with a possibility of filing an appeal before the competent court against the [ imposition of detention ] . The court shall rule within a time - limit of DATE from the filing of the appeal by means of a final decision . ”

“ GPE задържания се осигурява незабавно възможност да обжалва мярката за неотклонение пред съответния съд. Съдът се произнася в тридневен срок от подаването на жалбата с определение , което е окончателно. ”

CARDINAL . ORG of ORG has held that , in deciding on appeals against detention on remand , it is not open to the court to inquire whether there exists sufficient evidence supporting the charges against the detainee , but only to examine the lawfulness of the detention order ( опред. No . CARDINAL от CARDINAL по ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL , I н.о. на ВС , GPE DATE , стр. CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . According to the practice at the relevant time , the court examined appeals against detention on remand in camera , without the participation of the parties . If the appeal was dismissed , the court did not notify the detained person of the decision taken . An amendment of LAW of DATE introduced the requirement that appeals against detention on remand be examined at a hearing with the participation of the detainee .

CARDINAL . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG of ORG found that the imposition of detention on remand could be contested before a court only once ( опред. No . CARDINAL по GPE CARDINAL/CARDINAL , I н.о. на ВС , Сб. DATE , стр. CARDINAL ) . Until the amendment of LAW in DATE periodic judicial review of the lawfulness of detention on remand was only possible at the trial stage , when the criminal case was pending before a court .
